mods.abstract: Female adult, Off-white animal skin head, cloth body, jointed at shoulders and hips, molded face, features are done with beads, black beads for eyebrows and eyes, red for mouth, breaded human hair, off white skin dress, fringe on sleeves and hem of the dress, bead decoration on front and back yoke of bodice, bead decorated belt tied on front, bead decorated boots, beads necklace, earrings, another one longer skin necklace decorated with five white beads. Accompanying information describes that it is a south Dakota Indian doll. This doll was dressed by a very old Indian woman. She used her own dark hair on the doll. The bead work is of designs of the trive. All are hand-made.""
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
